value.name: ValenceSecurity
value.description: Leverage the Valence SaaS Security Platform API to enhance your investigation with data from SaaS applications such as Salesforce, GitHub, Okta, Google Workspace and dozens others. Answer critical questions to understand your existing SaaS threats and suspicious activities, what access level your human and non-human identities have, where your business-critical data is potentially exposed, and what are the most significant SaaS risks you should prioritize to fix.
value.descriptionDisplay: Find and fix your SaaS risks. Protect business-critical data and applications by streamlining incident investigations, and reducing SaaS identities, SaaS-to-SaaS integrations, data shares and misconfigurations risks.

value.name: CywareRespond
value.description:
Use this skillset to call Cyware Respond APIs to perform actions across the Cyware Respond platform.
- This skill invokes Cyware Respond's REST API
- In the all the APIs
  - You **should always** show the Incident UUID in the response and show the user. This will be required to add / act on the incident in future prompts
  - You **should always** ensure to include key fields such as Title, Description, Status, Readable ID, Unique ID, Motives and the others you deem fit for listing / searching incidents
  - When getting particular details about a component, You **should always** Ensure to include key info such as Title, Description, Status, Readable ID, Unique ID, Motives, Related Applications, Related Software's, Related Users, Related Malware and Related IOCs and the others you deem fit
value.descriptionDisplay: Automated Incident Response and threat analysis platform informed by extensive data visibility and advanced correlation to drive intelligent action from cybersecurity teams.

settings.name: InstanceURL
settings.label: Cyware Respond Instance URL
settings.description: The URL of the instance to connect to

value.name: RedCanary
value.description:
Enhance your security operations with this plugin, designed to seamlessly retrieve data from the Red Canary platform via its API. Features include:
- Telemetry: Access detection data, alerts, and investigative findings.
- Endpoints: Locate endpoints using name, ID, or other identifiers. 
- Users: Search for user profiles by name, ID, or username.
- Threats: Gather detailed threat intelligence, insights, and indicators of compromise.
- Platform Insights: Explore platform-specific analytics such as user logins and events ingested and investigated.
value.descriptionDisplay: The Red Canary plug-in enables enhanced security operations by combining the intelligence-driven detection capabilities of the Red Canary platform with the advanced AI insights of Microsoft Copilot for Security.
value.descriptionForModel: Retrieves data from the Red Canary platform through its API

settings.name: InstanceURL

value.name: CIRCL
value.description:
Use this skillset to call the CIRCL hash lookup service, empowering users to verify file hashes against CIRCL's database.
- What it does: Retrieves file information from the CIRCL's databases based on a file in either MD5, SHA-1, or SHA-256 hash format. 
- To what categories does it belong: file hash lookup, file search, MD5, SHA-1, SHA-256.
- Lookup information on CIRCL about a specific MD5 hash
- Lookup information on CIRCL about a specific SHA-1 hash
- Lookup information on CIRCL about a specific SHA-256 hash
- Bulk search on CIRCL of MD5 hashes
- Bulk search on CIRCL of SHA-1 hashes
- Published by Microsoft

value.name: CrowdSecTI
value.description:
Use this skillset to call the CrowdsecTI API if the user provides a given IP or list of IPs and wants to know more about:
- What it does: observed behaviors, targetted protocols, exploited vulnerabilities, etc.
- To what categories does it belong: proxy/VPN, CDN exit node, Legit security scanner, etc.
- What it targets: Country/region, services, etc.
- Existing cross-references: Existing lists, etc.
- How virulent it is
- For how long it has been reported by users
- The confidence level of the information.
- Published by Microsoft

Crowdsec's CTI API community plan uses one primary dataset:
- smoke: reflects most of the IPs reported by Crowdsec users

value.name: Fusion

This skillset contains skills to enrich incident data with device context from Intune, file context from Microsoft Defender for Endpoint, or threat intelligence context from Defender Threat Intelligence. This skillset also includes a skill to retrieve incident data, whether from Sentinel or Defender.

value.name: Generic
value.description: Skills for filtering, parsing, answering, understanding, and analysis.
value.descriptionForModel: Skills that answer common security questions, including analyzing code and scripts, extracting indicators of compromise (IOCs) from text, generating examples of security events, code or instructions, and formatting or summarizing text, articles or the content of web pages.

value.name: GreyNoiseCommunity
value.description:
Use this skillset to call the GreyNoise API if the user provides a given IP and wants to know assess the likelihood of the IP address being associated with abusive or malicious activities.
- This skill only invokes the community API.
- Lookup IP Address Noise: Gets noise information about an IP address (v4 or v6). Noise information is background activity generated by an IP address and can help determine if an IP address is associated with malicious activities.
- Provides contextual information about the IP address (organization, ASN, geolocation)
- Classifies the IP address as benign, suspicious, or malicious
- Assigns a tag to the IP address (scanner, botnet, IoT, etc.)
- Describes of the IP's behavior
- Informs which organization is associated with the IP address
- Provides the Autonomous System Number (ASN) associated with the IP address
- Gives the geolocation of the IP address
- Presents the last time the IP address was observed
- Published by Microsoft

value.name: GreyNoiseEnterprise
value.description:
Use this skillset to call the GreyNoise Enterprise API if the user provides a query or IP address and wants advanced knowledge about the IP address. This skillset is useful for determining if an IP address is associated with blocklisted activities.
- This skill invokes the enterprise API.
- Noise Contextual API: Requires knowledge of IP addresses and understanding of internet scanning activities. Ability to interpret context about an IP's behavior is crucial.
- Noise Quick API: Requires basic understanding of IP addresses and the concept of "noise" in network traffic. Ability to quickly analyze and interpret whether an IP address is likely to be just "noise".
- Noise Multi API: Requires understanding of multiple IP addresses and the ability to analyze them in bulk. Knowledge of how to interpret whether a set of IP addresses are likely to be "noise".
- RIOT API: Requires knowledge of IP addresses and allowlisted IPs. Ability to interpret whether an IP address is allowlisted.
- GNQL API: Requires advanced knowledge of the GreyNoise Query Language (GNQL) and the ability to construct complex queries to extract specific information from the GreyNoise dataset.
- Metadata API: Requires understanding of metadata and its importance in a dataset. Ability to interpret metadata about the GreyNoise dataset.
- Account API: Requires understanding of account management and the ability to interpret account-related information.
- Published by Microsoft
value.descriptionDisplay: IP addresses, RIOT information, and GNQL queries

value.name: Intune
value.description: Skills that query Microsoft Intune, such as looking up Intune managed devices, detected apps on a device, app protection policies
value.descriptionForModel: Skills that query Microsoft Intune APIs. Intune is a cloud-based endpoint management solution. The functions in this collection return device information, help users manage configuration policies, and provide user analytics reporting related to Intune and devices. They also help provide security and policy recommendations and answer support questions around device management.

value.name: Investigation
value.description: Collection of skills that cater to investigation based problems.
value.descriptionForModel: Skills that help with investigations, such as visualizing an investigation as a graph.

value.name: KnowledgeBase
value.description: Skills that interact with the Microsoft knowledge base mainly for question answering
value.descriptionForModel: Skills that answer common security questions from Microsoft knowledge base like Microsoft Learn webpages.

value.name: LearnKnowledgeService
value.description: Skills that interact with the Microsoft Learn Knowledge Service mainly for question answering, topic searching. It will retrieve relevant data for any 1st party products, like Microsoft Purview, Intune, Entra, Defender, and other Microsoft 365 products.
value.descriptionDisplay: Enable 1st party partners to search Microsoft Learn Content for any given question ask related to Microsoft Purview, Intune, Entra, Defender, or other Microsoft 365 documentation.
value.descriptionForModel: Skills to search documentation related to 1st party partners from Microsoft Learn documentation. Those 1st party partners are included but not limited to Microsoft Purview, Intune, Entra, Defender, or other Microsoft 365 products. Used when a user have a question that cannot be answered directly by another skillset and that question is related to 1st party partners, such as Microsoft Purview, Intune, Entra, Defender, or other Microsoft 365 products.

Use this skillset if the user context indicates they are requesting data from Microsoft 365 Defender (M365D), including incidents, incident report and guided response recommendations for incidents.

value.description: Skills to generate and run KQL queries against Microsoft 365 Advanced Hunting.

Used when a user have a question that cannot be answered directly by another skillset and that requires querying the underlying data sources included in M365 Defender. These data sources include data about emails, alerts, processes, identities and roles, logins, URL's.
